name: maladroitness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being awkward in movement or unskilled in behaviour or action: His social maladroitness in real life contrasts with his skill on stage. The dancers complained about the maladroitness of their clumsy partners. See
maladroit
More examplesFewer examplesThere are few exceptions to his administration's overwhelming maladroitness.What surprised me most was the timidity and maladroitness of the young men.It's been ages since I've watched Chaplin's movies, and I've missed his graceful maladroitness.
